div.p: ANTONIO: What are some ways I can reward myself for making low-risk choices? One thing I could do is consistently put aside the money that I would have spent on alcohol or drugs.
ANTONIO: After a while, I'll have enough money saved to buy myself something I've been wanting.
ANTONIO: One Prime for Life student did just that, and he eventually was able buy a pickup truck with the money he saved when he stopped buying beer, and started making low-risk choices.
ANTONIO: If monetary rewards are not as motivating, what other rewards would work for you? People often find they have free time that used to be spent drinking, or using.
ANTONIO: They might reward themselves by taking a special trip or spending more time with family.
